title: The Weary Woodcutter
caption: Life can be hard. / We all face struggles. / Sometimes, we just want it to end. / But be careful what you wish for. / What seems like relief... / ...might bring unforeseen consequences.
prompt: A weary old woodcutter, hunched over a bundle of sticks in a desolate forest. He is visually exhausted, with sweat dripping from his brow. The forest is dark and imposing.

title: Summoning the Specter
caption: One day, the woodcutter cried out. / He called for Death to take him. / A shadowy figure appeared. / Tall and cloaked in darkness. / Death had answered his plea. / Now, he faced a difficult choice.
prompt: A dark, shadowy figure of Death materializing before the startled woodcutter in the forest. Death is depicted as a tall, cloaked figure with a skeletal face partially obscured by the hood. The woodcutter is recoiling in fear.

title: Unexpected Request
caption: Death asked, 'What do you wish?' / The woodcutter hesitated. / He suddenly remembered... / ...the weight of the sticks. / He stammered, 'Help me with this burden!' / Death smirked at his change of heart.
prompt: The woodcutter, now visibly anxious, pointing at the bundle of sticks on the ground. Death stands beside him, his shadowy hand extended towards the sticks with a hint of amusement in his posture.

title: Death's Assistance
caption: Death, surprisingly, obliged. / He helped the woodcutter with the sticks. / The burden was lifted...literally. / But what about the bigger burden? / The burden of life itself?
prompt: Death, in a surprising act, assisting the old woodcutter in lifting the bundle of sticks. The woodcutter looks confused and slightly relieved, while Death maintains a neutral, almost helpful, expression.

title: The Moment of Clarity
caption: The woodcutter realized his folly. / He had wished for death... / ...but only wanted relief. / He learned a valuable lesson. / Wishing for an end... / ...isn't always the answer.
prompt: A close-up on the woodcutter's face, showing a mixture of understanding, regret, and a newfound appreciation for life. Sunlight peeks through the trees, illuminating his face.

title: A Second Chance
caption: Death vanished into the shadows. / The woodcutter was left alone. / He had been given a second chance. / A chance to appreciate life. / A chance to find joy. / Even in simple tasks.
prompt: The woodcutter standing alone in the forest, the bundle of sticks now appearing less daunting. He is looking towards the horizon with a determined expression. The forest seems slightly brighter than before.

title: Appreciating the Small Things
caption: He carried the sticks home. / With a lighter heart. / He saw beauty in the world. / He found joy in the simple things. / The sun, the trees, the birds. / All precious gifts.
prompt: The woodcutter walking through the forest, carrying the bundle of sticks with a smile. He is surrounded by vibrant foliage and sunlight, showcasing the beauty of nature.

title: The Moral of the Story
caption: Be careful what you wish for. / Despair can blind us. / Look for solutions, not endings. / Life is precious. / Even when it's hard. / Cherish every moment.
prompt: An open book with the words 'Be Careful What You Wish For' prominently displayed. Around the book are symbolic representations of life, such as a blooming flower, a flowing river, and a setting sun.

title: The Gift of Perspective
caption: The old man lived on. / With a new perspective. / He faced his challenges. / With strength and gratitude. / He understood the value of life. / A lesson learned from Death itself.
prompt: The woodcutter, now older but wiser, sitting on his porch and watching the sunset with a peaceful smile. He appears content and grateful for his life.

title: Embrace the Journey
caption: So, embrace the journey. / Find joy in the everyday. / Even in the face of hardship. / Remember the woodcutter's tale. / Life is a gift. / Unpack it carefully.
prompt: A winding road through a beautiful landscape, symbolizing the journey of life. The road leads towards a bright and hopeful horizon.
